paragraphs.name: 115f
paragraphs.text: Rather listen than read? I’ve got you covered.

paragraphs.name: 906a
paragraphs.text: As Covid-19 continues to wreak havoc on healthcare and economic systems around the world, people are turning to their governments for help during these trying times. While stimulus packages on the individual level still generally exist in the promise-realm, the corporate world is set to receive a series of trillion-dollar capital injections. Nothing new. Or is it? In reality, what we’ve witnessed over the last few weeks is nothing short of incredible.

paragraphs.name: be7f
paragraphs.text: The World of Work is Changing and You Should be Too

previewContent.subtitle: Too often when people describe their jobs or careers the positives come equipped with extreme caveats- e.g. I like the content but I’m…

paragraphs.name: be7f
paragraphs.text: The World of Work is Changing and You Should be Too

Too often when people describe their jobs or careers the positives come equipped with extreme caveats- e.g. I like the content but I’m stuck with no flexibility; my colleagues are great but I don’t feel like my work has a purpose; I’m knocking these projects out of the park, yet my boss won’t quit micromanaging me, etc.

The reality is that these ‘yea, buts’ can overshadow the positive attributes and lead to dissatisfaction in the workplace, eating away at the sanity and sanctity of workers and in turn reducing the productivity of firms.
